heading: Vault Overview
subheading: Vault provides encryption services that are gated by authentication and authorization methods. Use Vault to securely store, access, and manage secrets and other sensitive data.

blocks.heading: Introduction to Vault
blocks.text: Welcome to Vault! This introduction section gives an overview of what Vault is, what problems it can solve, how it compares to existing software, and contains a quick start for using Vault.

cards.heading: Vault Documentation
cards.text: Find user references for Vault concepts, server configuration, upgrade guides, release notes, FAQs, and more.

cards.heading: Vault CLI
cards.text: Vault features a command-line interface (CLI) that wraps common functionality and formats output.

cards.heading: Vault API
cards.text: This is the Vault HTTP API reference. Find the API endpoints and available parameters.

cards.heading: Vault Install
cards.text: Download the proper package for your operating system and architecture to get started.

cards.heading: Vault Secrets Engine
cards.text: Secrets engines are pluggable components which store, generate, or encrypt sensitive data.

cards.heading: Key/Value Secrets Engine
cards.text: Vault's key/value secrets engine encrypts and store arbitrary secrets.

cards.heading: Database Secrets Engine
cards.text: Dynamically generates database credentials based on pre-configured roles.

cards.heading: Transit Secrets Engine
cards.text: Encrypt data in-transit to provide encryption as a service.

cards.heading: Transform Secrets Engine
cards.text: An Enterprise feature generates cryptographically secure tokens mapped to secure highly sensitive data.

cards.heading: PKI Secret Engine
cards.text: The PKI secrets engine generates dynamic X.509 certificates.

cards.heading: TLS Certificates Auth Method
cards.text: Authenticate using SSL/TLS client certificates that are either signed by a CA or self-signed.

cards.heading: Build Your Own Certificate Authority (CA)
cards.text: Walkthrough the user of the PKI secrets engine to create X.509 certificates.

cards.heading: Vault Helm Chart
cards.text: Use the Vault Helm chart to install and configure Vault on Kubernetes.

cards.heading: Agent Sidecar Injector
cards.text: Alters pod specifications to include Vault Agent containers that render secrets.

cards.heading: Vault on Kubernetes Deployment Guide
cards.text: Describes steps to install and configure a single Vault cluster on Kubernetes.
